result.execSummary:
Bettie L McNeal was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Bettie L McNeal was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bettie L McNeal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Extradition
Per Judge Foster.
signed by defendant and Judge Foster (copy, original give to DA)

Defendant Bettie L McNeal in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives the extradition hearing.  Court approves and signs waiver of extradition.  Defendant to remain in custody pending transfer to the Lake County, Illinois authorities.
Hearing on June 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Bettie L McNeal in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties have received the report.  Defense does not challenge the findings.  Court finds defendant competent to proceed.  Court addresses bail.  Court orders cash bail reduced  to $2,000.00.  This matter to follow along with 15CF319 for further scheduling.  Hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
by Dr. Rawski dated 5/5/15
Filed by the Defendant requesting a new attorney be appointed.
Hearing on May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Warrant for Commitment

Defendant Bettie L McNeal in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is concerned that extradition would interfere with prosecuting the other matter.  Defense requests a competency evaluation.  Court orders competency evaluation be completed and report filed within 15 days.  Court signs the Warrant for Commitment.  All other time limits are tolled.  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
on defendant's Motion Requesting Modification of Bail
Hearing on April 22, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Bettie L McNeal in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for motion to modify bail.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court denies defendant's motion to modify bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  State requests quick turn around date to check on status of extradition.  Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 10:45 am.
WC inmate communication for received today, from the Defendant to Judge Foster.

Clerk's letter to the defendant advising she must work through her attorney if she wishes to pursue a motion to modify bail.
filed by defendant requesting court date for a bail reduction.
Hearing on April 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Bettie L McNeal in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
